results.title: Synergistic action of ursolic acid and metformin in experimental model of insulin resistance and related behavioral alterations.
results.text_hl: The findings of our study revealed that improvement in insulin sensitivity, learning and cognitive performance in stressed @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ was attributed to attenuation of proinflammatory cytokines and oxidative @<m>DISEASE_Psychological_Distress</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000079225 @@@stress@@@. Moreover, combination of [@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (150 mg/kg) + @CHEMICAL_ursolic_acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:C005466 @@@Ursolic acid@@@ (10 mg/kg)] produced enhanced improvement in insulin sensitivity and @DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive impairment@@@ as compared to their individual effects, suggesting possibly the common mode of anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ and antioxidant mechanisms.

citations.NLM: Mourya A, Akhtar A, Ahuja S, Sah SP, Kumar A. Synergistic action of ursolic acid and metformin in experimental model of insulin resistance and related behavioral alterations. Eur J Pharmacol. 2018 Sep 15;835():31-40. PMID: 30075220

results.title: [Effects of metformin on depressive behavior in chronic stress rats].
results.journal: Zhongguo Ying Yong Sheng Li Xue Za Zhi
results.text_hl: Compared with CUMS group, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment had no significant effect on body weight of @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, but it could significantly improve @CHEMICAL_Sucrose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013395 @@@sucrose@@@ water intake, immobility time and spontaneous activity of @<m>DISEASE_Psychological_Distress</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000079225 @@@CUMS depression@@@ model @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ (P<0.05), and improve the abnormal morphological changes of hippocampus in CUMS @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Li GF, Zhao M, Zhao T, Cheng X, Fan M, Zhu LL. [Effects of metformin on depressive behavior in chronic stress rats]. Zhongguo Ying Yong Sheng Li Xue Za Zhi. 2019 May 28;35(3):245-249. PMID: 31257807
citations.BibTeX: @article{31257807, title={[Effects of metformin on depressive behavior in chronic stress rats].}, author={Li GF and Zhao M and Zhao T and Cheng X and Fan M and Zhu LL}, journal={Zhongguo Ying Yong Sheng Li Xue Za Zhi}, volume={35}, number={3}, pages={245-249}}

results.title: Diazepam Potentiates the Antidiabetic, Antistress and Anxiolytic Activities of Metformin in Type-2 Diabetes Mellitus with Cooccurring Stress in Experimental Animals
results.text_hl: Therefore, the basic objective of the present study was to evaluate the antidiabetic effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Diazepam @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003975 @@@diazepam@@@, and their combination in cooccurring @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Psychological_Distress</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000079225 @@@stress condition@@@ (DMS).

citations.NLM: Garabadu D, Krishnamurthy S. Diazepam Potentiates the Antidiabetic, Antistress and Anxiolytic Activities of Metformin in Type-2 Diabetes Mellitus with Cooccurring Stress in Experimental Animals Biomed Res Int. 2014;2014():693074. PMID: 24995322
